Literature Review: Free energy methods have revolutionized the field of molecular simulations, enabling researchers to accurately predict the underlying free-energy change in molecular processes. This review aims to provide an overview of the current landscape of free-energy methods, highlighting their importance in biophysics and the challenges that remain to be overcome. We will discuss the foundational principles of free-energy calculations, the various methods available today, and provide examples of molecular processes where these methods have been successfully applied. By examining the strengths and limitations of each approach, we hope to provide a clearer understanding of the current state of the field and guide researchers in choosing the best-suited algorithm for their specific problem.
